Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: python

Arguments.Name: c
Arguments.Description: Execute the Python code in command. command can be one or more statements separated by newlines, with significant leading whitespace as in normal module code

Arguments.Name: command
Arguments.Description: command

Arguments.Name: m
Arguments.Description: Module

Arguments.Name: python module
Arguments.Description: python module

Arguments.Name: http.server
Arguments.Description: python module
Print a short description of all command line options

Arguments.Name: -V
Arguments.Description: Print the Python version number and exit

Arguments.Name: b
Arguments.Description: Issue a warning when comparing bytes or bytearray with str or bytes with int. Issue an error when the option is given twice (-bb)

Arguments.Name: B
Arguments.Description: If given, Python won’t try to write .pyc files on the import of source modules

Arguments.Name: --check-hash-based-pycs
Arguments.Description: Control the validation behavior of hash-based .pyc files. See Cached bytecode invalidation

Arguments.Name: d
Arguments.Description: Turn on parser debugging output (for expert only, depending on compilation options)

Arguments.Name: E
Arguments.Description: Ignore all PYTHON* environment variables, e.g. PYTHONPATH and PYTHONHOME, that might be set

Arguments.Name: i
Arguments.Description: When a script is passed as first argument or the -c option is used, enter interactive mode after executing the script or the command, even when sys.stdin does not appear to be a terminal

Arguments.Name: I
Arguments.Description: Run Python in isolated mode. This also implies -E and -s. In isolated mode sys.path contains neither the script’s directory nor the user’s site-packages directory

Arguments.Name: O
Arguments.Description: Remove assert statements and any code conditional on the value of __debug__

Arguments.Name: -OO
Arguments.Description: Do -O and also discard docstrings

Arguments.Name: g
Arguments.Description: Don’t display the copyright and version messages even in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: Turn on hash randomization. This option only has an effect if the PYTHONHASHSEED environment variable is set to 0, since hash randomization is enabled by default

Arguments.Name: s
Arguments.Description: Don’t add the user site-packages directory to sys.path

Arguments.Name: S
Arguments.Description: Disable the import of the module site and the site-dependent manipulations of sys.path that it entails

Arguments.Name: u
Arguments.Description: Force the stdout and stderr streams to be unbuffered. This option has no effect on the stdin stream

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: Print a message each time a module is initialized, showing the place (filename or built-in module) from which it is loaded

Arguments.Name: W
Arguments.Description: Warning control. Python’s warning machinery by default prints warning messages to sys.stderr

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: Skip the first line of the source, allowing use of non-Unix forms of #!cmd. This is intended for a DOS specific hack only

Arguments.Name: X
Arguments.Description: Reserved for various implementation-specific options

Arguments.Name: python script
Arguments.Description: python script
